original_text:
**INSTITUTION
NEUROSURGERY
DISCHARGE SUMMARY
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB]
ACCOUNT #
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Nov 02 2007]
DISCHARGE DATE :
ADMISSION DIAGNOSIS :
Essential tremor .
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS :
Essential tremor .
PROCEDURE :
Placement of a left thalamic deep brain stimulator for essential tremor .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
The patient is a **AGE[in 60s]- year - old male with a history of a right worse than left essential tremor .
He was brought in for a placement of elective left thalamic DBS .
The placement was performed without any difficulty with good control of his tremor intraoperatively .
Postoperatively , the patient was transferred to the floor where he did not have any problems .
He was tolerating a regular diet , voiding without the need for Foley , ambulating per his usual status , and his pain was controlled with p.o. pain medications .
He will be discharged to home on **DATE[Nov 3 2007] .
He will follow up with Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] in 2 weeks , at which point his deep brain stimulator will be turned on .
He will be discharged home with Vicodin as needed for pain .
___________________________________
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
Dictator :
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
